title: Chicago XII -- Hot Streets (12)
description:
Unfortunately, after Terry Kath died the band lost its soul for a while.  It regained its soul later, metamorphosized into what it is now.  but there were some soulless years.

Hot Streets is the worst of those 3 transition albums.  If you&#039;ve never heard of Donnie Dacus, there&#039;s a reason why -- he sucks.  But he was the new blood the band brough in along with new producer Phil Ramone.  Completists need this album and there are a couple of kewl tunes.  But really, try to forget this album and swallow it as a pill of necessity to get to later ones.



Alive Again

The Greatest Love

Little Miss Lovin&#039;

Hot Streets

Take a Chance

Gone Long Gone

Ain&#039;t It Time

Love Was New

No Tell Lover

Show Me the Way

Love Was New (Alternative version)
